availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in 1822-1823 in Kentucky. Married to Janie Kimbrell. Children included Nancy, Patsey, Hannah, Joseph, Richard, Ennis, John, Sally, and Mary. Enlisted in First Kentucky Cavalry Regiment on August 16, 1861. Promoted from Sergeant to 1st Lieutenant June 10, 1862.

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, citiny p. 17, family 107, NARA microfilm publication M593 (Washington D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, n.d.); FHL microfilm 545,983; Sergeant E. Tarrant, The Wild Riders of the First Kentucky Cavalry : a History of the Regiment, in the Great War of the Rebellion, 1861-1865 : Pathetic Scenes, Amusing Incidents, and Thrilling Episodes, a Regimental Roster, Prison Life, Adventures, and Escapes (New York: New York Public Library, 1894), 424.
